body: Thanks, PTAL!
I mixed up the commits. I'm closing this.
I squashed all the commits together. The tox issue still reproduces. Note that tox runs on Linux and flags no issues whatsoever. : )
PTAL.
PTAL

To have a javadoc, I added the javadoc plugin to pom.xml.

javadoc diff for the Read transform: https://gist.github.com/jkff/9128e4d33b7defba493df9fdbdd5c365/revisions - it looks almost the same, except methods are abstract and the protected constructor now appears.

I did not change the Write transform because there's no gain to be had from AutoValue in it because it currently has just 1 parameter (project id).
Green. Squashing and merging.
R: @chamikaramj

Thanks for the PR @sumitchawla. Which commit is the stack trace based on? The line numbers indicate it is an older version. We've recently made some changes [1, 2] to the `UnboundedSourceWrapper` which should prevent such NullPointerExceptions.

Could you verify this is reproducible with the latest Beam master? That would be great. 

[1] https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/967
[2] https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/927

Looks like travis is still unhappy, two worrisome points are:

Archetype repository not defined. Using the one from [org.apache.beam:beam-sdks-java-maven-archetypes-examples:0.2.0-incubating] found in catalog remote

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-archetype-plugin:2.4:generate (default-cli) on project beam-sdks-java-parent: A Maven 2 project already exists in the directory /Users/travis/build/apache/incubator-beam/sdks/java/test-beam-archetypes-examples -> [Help 1]

R: @lukecwik 

Not yet ready to merge; BigtableIOTest and BigQueryIOTest aren't ready to split in their unit tests

Hmm, the javadoc change _ought to_ be unnecessary, though I'll be darned if I can figure out maven properly. It should be inherited from parents, as we've made Javadoc on-by-default and disabled in certain legacy modules that were not yet ready.

E.g., the old configuration does produce javadoc for GCP IOs: http://beam.incubator.apache.org/learn/sdks/javadoc/0.2.0-incubating/
Aside from the Javadoc config change, LGTM.
PTAL @jasonkuster
LGTM

Btw, suggest emailing the dev@ list with this change. It's worth digging up references to a few older threads and pieces of code where this is useful.

And noting that this is not changing semantics of the model in any way, but pulling out a useful pattern somewhere everyone can see it :)
[Before merging]
Removed javadoc config change - see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-729
It looks like the travis failure is spurious. I'm going to rebase and squash to kick off a new run.
R: @kennknowles
This is nice, Thanks!. LGTM
@mxm  i noticed this error in org.apache.beam:beam-runners-flink_2.10:0.3.0-incubating-20160923.071319-53

@kennknowles I was looking at the WordCount code and realized that should be in `RegexTransform`. I added a `split` method that will allow the word splitting portion of WordCount to be done as `words.apply(RegexTransform.split("\W*"));`.
@eljefe6a indeed, very appropriate. This is still on my radar FYI.
Weird, the Travis error looks transient (hung build).
Looks like something's wrong with the build itself, mvn clean verify passes locally for me.
LGTM
LGTM

R: @robertwb 
Please merge
Travis failure is due to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-721, and not related to this change.
R: @chamikaramj
Thanks @mxm .. I verified in beam-runners-flink_2.10:0.3.0-incubating-20161007.071542-68.  This is no longer reproducible.

R: @kennknowles 

CC: @dhalperi 

This should fix the flakyness in jenkins. 2500 runs on my desktop don't reproduce the flake with this change.
This can be closed now.
The code is still worth reviewing, however. Those tests are broken because they don't expect the runner to split rather than because the added code is broken.
Still reviewing. I also want to wait and give @aljoscha a chance to comment on the API proposal thread.
Thanks.
LGTM pending green

@aaltay I added the checks: If `tox` is installed, then update TOX_HOME to the right place. Otherwise, install it. The fix has run fine three times already:
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/builds/165958424
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/builds/165960898
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/builds/165961980

I didn't look into the different image issues, because it seems that [travis ci does not officially support python on mac yet](https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/2312). I think for now this should be fine.
R: @mariapython
I have also a [code change](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1068) that fixes the `tox` issue.
All the linked runs, ran with the image that has tox preinstalled. Do you have successful run with other images?
PTAL, build passed.

Not at the moment. I'll trigger a few runs by closing/opening the PR. To be fair, though, all the Python runs that I found from the last two days have come with `tox` preinstalled:
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/165945731
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/165929142
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/165963568
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/builds/165665252
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/165401745
- https://travis-ci.org/apache/incubator-beam/jobs/165389942

LGTM. Thanks.

Do tests and lint pass locally ? Seems like tests are failing here due to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-721.

Maybe there was a rolling change to Travis. If there will be a single image with tox installed, then we do not need the branch to check whether it is installed or not.

Either way, let's wait for your test runs to complete.

Thanks for taking a look. 

Yes, the tests pass locally, and they all pass on the linux travis-cl build too.
I filed an [issue to Travis](https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/6696) to find out if that's the case.
Superseded by https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1069
Thanks for testing with the latest version!

According to the Travis people: They don't officially support Python, but they've pushed a new Mac image on 10/04 that might have changed the behavior.

If they don't support Python, it's feasible that they'll push an image that will again not come with Tox - so it might be fine to leave the code as is in this PR. What do you think?
R: @jbonofre

LGTM.

According to the Travis [blog post](https://blog.travis-ci.com/2016-10-04-osx-73-default-image-live/) they will maintain multiple images at least until the end of October and maybe longer. So, it makes sense to keep this code as it is.

Travis failure is due to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-721 and not related to this change.

I believe this change is ready except for the one comment I added above.
The [ticket](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-735) contains a clear explanation for why this is needed.
R: @kennknowles
@robertwb can you review and commit if appropriate? : ) - received LGTM from aaltay.

+1 on the `TODO` for unit test. This is becoming tricky.
BTW I see that `PartitionState` has a `latestOffset` field, why not add that to the CheckpointMark ? we won't need different flags if we have another state, and we seem to track it anyway.
Thanks for doing this. I think this is good. I'll merge.

This change LGTM.

The last travis error is still due to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-721 and not related to this change. (It might be useful to rerun travis since the underlying issue is fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1068)
Relaunching tests.
R: @jkff
Shall I consider the GitHub approval an LGTM?
Yeah, LGTM
LGTM
After some consideration of the alternatives, I don't think this is the right long-term move. Since I've already done most of the work in the harder alternative, I'll work on that.

I will look into adding a unit test.

It is getting cumbersome to track 'consumedOffset'. Changed the implementation to store `next offset` instead. 

I changed it in CheckpointMark also. That implies an update could be off by one. I don't think there any Dataflow apps in prod that also depend heavily on update(). I think it worth the small incompatibility at this stage.
We are going to change checkpoint serialization to Avro to handle future updates better. 

cc: @dhalperi , @amitsela
What is the advantage of storing latest_offset in Checkpoint? We are tracking it to be able to report backlog to the runner.
R: @charlesccychen
LGTM
R: @robertwb

@robertwb Please review.

Jenkins failure is unrelated to this change and being fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1081
Yes, that is in progress.

LGTM

nit:
remove the comment of ListOutputManager in here:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/master/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/DoFnTester.java#L774
LGTM, though I don't know if an empty file (or its position in a source tree) is technically copyright-able :).

Looks like there is an option called trimStackTrace which defaults to true which we want to default to false. See:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2928548/make-mavens-surefire-show-stacktrace-in-console
LGTM
LGTM.
OK, I changed the PR to specify types when creating the IO - which is type-safe. PTAL.
R: @amitsela as a randomly selected committer (@peihe touched this code most recently so I got his input first)
LGTM!
R: @jbonofre
Rebased on master with the BigQueryTornadoesIT fix.
LGTM
LGTM

And thanks 😉, things sometimes move fast around here and that's a very efficient way to bring things to my attention.
I'll start playing around with this and see how to use it in the runner - maybe even as part of #1055
I don't think there is an advantage to storing latest_offset now that you're tracking nextOffset, I'll have a look.
@robertwb Ive implemented the changes suggested in the pr. Is there anything else you'd like to see?

The travis error seems to be due to the ongoing issues we're having with OS X tox. I've merged this, you can close this PR now. 

Thanks again for your contribution!
R: @dhalperi as committer.

Thanks @tim1357 for the contribution and Robert for the review. LGTM as well.

@tim1357, to avoid any confusion/conflicts, could you do any extra development on top of https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1053 (which I will work on resolving/merging soon)?

turned off trimStackTrace in maven-failsafe-plugin
(mavens-surefire-plugin is already off)

New integration testing has shown up a migration pathway that I had neglected. I'll need to either do some major refactoring to make the migration trivial or else add `StateSpec` almost fully parallel, port things do it, then alter `StateTag`.

Please remove the now duplicate configuration in:
sdks/java/io/kinesis/pom.xml
examples/java/pom.xml
sdks/java/io/google-cloud-platform/pom.xml
Thanks JB! Fixed the conflicts, verified that it still passes, and merged.

removed the duplicated config property
PTAL
Back to you, @markflyhigh

R: @robertwb can you please take a look?

I've merged all the changes with @tim1357's PR (https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1007) which was already merged into Beam.

Please take another look. I have made it almost entirely additive, so I can port things to this first and also get started on the `DoFn` bits for state. (It turns out that even modifying `StateTable` has migration complications). About 30% less to review, and only the easy bits :-)
@dhalperi Just checking in on the status of this PR, at the request of my employer.  Let me know if you want to see something else changed.  Thanks.
